Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
fix: CRITICAL - resolve user menu wrapping issue by fixing viewport-optimizations.css universal max-width rule

Fixed mobile header layout where user dropdown menu was appearing below the header instead of staying on the same horizontal line with the hamburger menu.

Root Cause:
- viewport-optimizations.css had a universal `* { max-width: 100%; }` rule (line 696-699)
- This CSS file loads AFTER shared/styles.css, overriding the `max-width: none` fixes
- The universal rule was forcing header flex children to wrap to new lines on narrow viewports
- Despite header having `flex-wrap: nowrap`, the max-width constraint was causing layout breaks

Changes:
- Modified viewport-optimizations.css universal selector to EXCLUDE header elements:
  - Excluded: header, header *, .header-controls, .header-controls *, .user-menu, .user-menu *, .mobile-nav-toggle, .logo, .logo *
  - Added explicit rule for header elements with NO max-width constraint
- Bumped viewport-optimizations.css version from 1.1 to 1.2
- Updated version reference in ALL HTML files (14 files total)

Technical Details:
- The universal `max-width: 100%` was meant to prevent horizontal scroll
- However, it was breaking flex layouts in the header where elements need to stay on one line
- The fix allows header elements to flex properly without width constraints
- Other page elements still have the max-width protection to prevent horizontal scroll

This fix addresses the recurring header layout issue that has been attempted to be fixed in previous commits:
- "fix: CRITICAL mobile header layout - prevent vertical stacking" (a1cda89)
- "fix: Remove flex constraints forcing avatar out of header" (419961a)
- "fix: CRITICAL - prevent avatar from wrapping to new line below header" (5b95ca0)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
